thread.title: Geneva man dies from injuries sustained in Batavia crash Aurora Beacon-News
thread.title_full: Geneva man dies from injuries sustained in Batavia crash - Aurora Beacon-News

author: Erika Wurst
title: Geneva man dies from injuries sustained in Batavia crash Aurora Beacon-News
text:
A Geneva man died early Monday after a Sunday evening crash in Batavia that also left his female passenger seriously injured, Batavia police said.
Police announced Tuesday that Todd Baker, 66, died bout 1:40 a.m. Monday, about seven hours after he crashed his 1997 Sunbeam Alpine near Fabyan Parkway and Batavia Avenue.
According to police, Baker was traveling east on Fabyan Parkway about 7:20 p.m. Sunday when he went to make a left turn onto northbound Batavia Avenue.
At that same time, a 2004 Jeep Liberty, driven by an 18-year-old Geneva man, was traveling west on Fabyan Parkway approaching Batavia Avenue. Both he and Baker had green lights when they collided in the intersection, police said.
Baker and his female passenger were both seriously injured in the crash. The Jeep's driver refused medical treatment.
After being extricated from the vehicle, Baker was transported to Delnor Hospital and then airlifted to Good Samaritan Hospital in Downers Grove where he died.
Baker's passenger, who was ejected from the Sunbeam, was flown to Good Samaritan Hospital from the crash scene. She remains hospitalized, and her condition is unknown, police said.
No citations were issued.
ewurst@tribpub.com
Two hospitalized in Batavia crash Linda Girardi Two people were hospitalized after a two-vehicle crash on the northwest side of Batavia on Sunday night.
Batavia firefighters found two vehicles with "moderate to heavy damage" after being called to an area near Route 31 and Fabyan Parkway at about 7:24 p.m., according to a fire department spokesman.
